subject: History
title: The Tomb of Genghis Khan
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Tomb of Genghis Khan usable.

hook.text: The man who conquered half the known world was buried in a grave no one has ever found.

buildup.text: Genghis Khan died in 1227. His followers executed everyone who saw the funeral procession to keep the location secret.

discovery.text: Legend says a river was diverted over the grave, and horses trampled the site to erase all traces.

twist.text: Mongolians consider the grave sacred. Many locals actively oppose archaeological searches out of deep respect.

climax.text: Satellite imagery and ground-penetrating radar have found promising sites, but excavation remains culturally forbidden.

punchline.text: The world's greatest conqueror hid better in death than in life.

quiz.question: Why hasn't Genghis Khan's tomb been found despite modern technology?
options: It was destroyed by a rival Mongol clan
Mongolians consider it sacred and oppose excavation
The tomb is believed to be under the ocean
